description:
The QY_GPP product is a Global 8-day composite Gross Primary Productivity (GPP) product provided at 500m spatial resolution based on Sentinel 3 Ocean and Land Colour Image (OLCI) L2 data. The QY_GPP product is derived using the Quantum Yield (QY) Model, which is based on the light use efficiency concept, and generates GPP as a product of photosynthetic pathway (i.e., C3 and C4) quantum yield (α mol mol -1) and time averaged fraction of photosynthetically active radiation absorbed by chlorophyll (FAPARchl; µmol m -2 s -1). The QY_GPP product is provided in tiles, following the MODIS tilling system, and is presented in sinusoidal coordinate reference system which is embedded in each individual file. The directory names are in ISO-date notation, i.e. of the form YYYY-MM-DD. The data is stored using 16 bits (with a shift factor of 1000) in two bands, with the first band representing the GPP value in gCm-2day-1 and the second band containing a series of bit-quality flags for each pixel. The development and production of the QY_GPP product by the University of Southampton, UK, was originally supported by European Space Agency (ESA) funding through the Sen4GPP project (ESA Contract No. 4000134598/21/I-NB).

Data Access

The root directory for the files is: https://s3.waw4-1.cloudferro.com/EarthCODE/OSCAssets/sen4gpp/

It contains subdirectories named by the date of the first day of the corresponding eight-day period, in the range 2020-01-01/ – 2024-12-29/.

The filename for each tile within these subdirectories is constructed as follows:

QISCARF_GPP_<datum>_<tile>_m0.830_b0.053_pc31.000_qi0.080_v02.tif

Example: For tile h20v04 at date 2020-01-01:

https://s3.waw4-1.cloudferro.com/EarthCODE/OSCAssets/sen4gpp/2020-01-01/QISCARF_GPP_20200101_h20v04_m0.830_b0.053_pc31.000_qi0.080_v02.tif

If using the STAC Catalog is not the most effective option for you, you can access the data directly via the following structure:

https://s3.waw4-1.cloudferro.com/EarthCODE/OSCAssets/sen4gpp/<datum>/QISCARF_GPP_20200101_<tile>_m0.830_b0.053_pc31.000_qi0.080_v02.tif

Where:

  • <datum> = requested date in YYYY-MM-DD format
  • <tile> = MODIS tile ID

Alternative Access via S3

You can also list and download the data directly using AWS CLI:

aws s3 ls --no-sign-request --endpoint-url https://s3.waw4-1.cloudferro.com s3://EarthCODE/OSCAssets/sen4gpp
title: Global Gross Primary Productivity (GPP) Dataset, University of Southampton
